de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.model.datastructure
Interface ArtefactType

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArtefactTypeImpl
public interface ArtefactType

Because we wanna build up a generic system we also need the artefact types generic. As a result of that constraint, we can't use an enumeration. To work around that hard coded enumeration we make use of this class.

For each artefact type supported we make an instance. The types are pre-defined in an external startup XML file which has to be parsed.

Example
The startup file looks something like that: 
 < system>
   < startup>
     < artefact>
       < type>type 1 supported< /type>
       < type>type 2 supported< /type>
       ...
     < /artefact>
   < /startup>
 < /system>
The types here defined are later found in the UI. When it comes to loading EMF Ecore model files the tester has the choice to link the data with one of this artefact types.

Since:
Apr/07/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Method Detail

isDummyFileAllowed

void isDummyFileAllowed(boolean dummy)
sets a flag, to tell, whether it is allowed to create a dummy file to this kind of artefact type. Not all types should have a dummy file, because it wouldn't make sense, to do so.

Example

Suppose you've got the artfact types documents and products. To document artefacts it is desired, to create dummy files to reflect the generated test data properly. But is is not desired to do so for product artefacts. It is impossible to create a dummy file for example to a refrigerator.

With this flag it is easier to tell the data generation process the needs.

Parameters:
dummy - is it allowed for this kind of type to create a dummy file.

isDummyFileAllowed

boolean isDummyFileAllowed()
sets a flag, to tell, whether it is allowed to create a dummy file to this kind of artefact type. Not all types should have a dummy file, because it wouldn't make sense, to do so.

Example

Suppose you've got the artfact types documents and products. To document artefacts it is desired, to create dummy files to reflect the generated test data properly. But is is not desired to do so for product artefacts. It is impossible to create a dummy file for example to a refrigerator.

With this flag it is easier to tell the data generation process the needs.

Returns:
true, if and only if there such a thing like a dummy file possible.

setName

void setName(java.lang.String artefactType)
sets the name of the artefact type supported. Artefac types are loaded during initializing phase of the system. They're loaded before the UI is shown. When it comes to load EMF Ecore model files, the tester has the choice to link the data to one of the artefact types.

Notice, artefact types separate the data into disjunct sets of testing data.

Parameters:
artefactType - name of an artefact type

getName

java.lang.String getName()
gets the name of this artefact type.

Returns:
name of artefact.
